title: Half-disk topology
summary: In mathematics, and particularly general topology, the half-disk topology is an example of a topology given to the set X {\displaystyle X} , given by all points ( x , y ) {\displaystyle (x,y)} in the plane such that y â‰¥ 0 {\displaystyle y\geq 0} .[1] The set X {\displaystyle X} can be termed the closed upper half plane.
